intro: Sarratia polygonoides, commonly known as the ghost flower, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean islands. It is a member of the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its small, pale pink to white flowers that resemble ghostly apparitions. The plant typically grows in shaded, moist environments and has hairy, narrow leaves. Its unique appearance and habitat make it a rare and ecologically significant species. Sarratia polygonoides is also known for its medicinal properties and is sometimes used in traditional remedies.
